repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Winfield Taylor papers
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT), founded in 1864, is one of the largest and oldest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. Winfield Taylor worked as a copywriter in the Creative Department of JWT from 1934 until 1960, becoming a Vice President in 1950. The Winfield Taylor Papers span the years 1948-1960 and include correspondence, memoranda, call reports, Review Board minutes, copy, product information, reports, and printed material. Notable correspondents include Joan Didion, Norman H. Strouse, Henry C. Flower, Jr., Samuel Meek, and John Monsarrat. Major clients include Ford, Shell, and Pan American.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Review Board minutes may not be photocopied.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. Winfield Taylor Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. Winfield Taylor Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a transfer in 1987.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by the J. Walter Thompson Company Archives, 1979
Accession 790718 is described in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT), founded in 1864, is one of the largest and oldest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. Winfield Taylor worked as a copywriter in the Creative Department of JWT from 1934 until 1960, becoming a Vice President in 1950. Taylor was born in Wilmette, Illinois. He attended Dartmouth College and, prior to joining JWT, worked at Marshall Field and Company, Henry Hearst and McDonald, McCann-Erickson, and the Curtis Publishing Company.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Winfield Taylor Papers span the years 1948-1960 and include correspondence, memoranda, call reports, Review Board minutes, copy, product information, reports, and printed material. Notable correspondents include Joan Didion; Norman H. Strouse; Henry C. Flower, Jr. ;Samuel Meek; andJohn Monsarrat. Major clients includeFord, Shell, and Pan American. Campaigns covered are Worth More...and Why for Ford, and This is the Captain Speaking for Pan American. There are also materials pertaining to the following clients: American Red Cross, Champion Spark Plug, Foundation for Commercial Banks, Institute of Life Insurance, Johns-Manville, Pharmacraft, Charles F. Orvis Company, RCA, Scott Paper, and Standard Brands.
The collection is organized into two series: General Files and Client Files.
The General Files Series includes correspondence and memoranda of a general nature, unassociated with specific clients or advertising campaigns, as well as miscellaneous personal items.
The Client Files Series documents Taylor's work with several clients, with the bulk of materials pertaining to his work for Ford and Shell.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The following materials were separated from the collection by the J. Walter Thompson Co. Archives:

Advertisements for Ford, Shell, American Red Cross and Pan American have been relocated to the J. Walter Thompson Company Domestic Advertisements Collection. Cross-reference sheets giving the headline of each advertisement are found in the first folder labeled Copy for each client. Thirteen Ford proof books dating from 1940 to 1957 and 11 Shell proof books dating from 1948 to 1956 have also been placed in the Domestic Advertisements Collection, but may not be cross-referenced within the collection.

Photographs and negatives of Shell's City of Tomorrow advertisement were placed in the J. Walter Thompson Company's Photograph Collection (presently called the Iconographic Collection) in the Clients series. A slide of this advertisement is also available in the Iconographic Collection, Clients Subseries, Slide SF34.

Duplicates of miscellaneous issues of the J. Walter Thompson Company News dating from 1957 to 1959 were discarded. A complete set of this publication for this period may be found in the J. Walter Thompson Company Newsletter Collection.
Two reel-to-reel tape recordings of Ford commercials, circa 1956, were transferred to the J. Walter Thompson Company. New York Office. Media Center Audio-Visual Collection in 1982.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Materials related to this collection may be found in other J. Walter Thompson Company collections, including the Account Files, Domestic Advertisements Collection, Iconographic Collection, Newsletter Collection, Review Board Records and the Sam Meek Papers.

controlaccess.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History
Institute of Life Insurance (New York, N.Y.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and memoranda of a general nature, unassociated with specific clients or advertising campaigns, as well as miscellaneous personal items.

did.unittitle: General correspondence and memoranda, 1953-1960 and undated

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials document Taylor's work with several clients, with the bulk of materials pertaining to his work for Ford and Shell. Materials include correspondence, memoranda, call reports, Review Board minutes, copy, product information, reports, and printed material.
The series is arranged into three subseries: Ford, Shell, andOther Clients.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Note on Restriction: Review Board minutes may not be photocopied.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Worth More and Why--Best Ford Ad for 1953.
